para.text: The Mayor shall issue regulations that prescribe the fee to be paid for:
An amendment or correction to a vital record that is not the fault of the Mayor or a District government agency;
A certified copy of a certificate or record;
A search of a file or record if no copy is made;
A copy or information provided for research, statistical, or administrative purposes;
Issuance of a new certificate of birth.

There is established as a lapsing special fund the Vital Records Fees Fund ("Fund"), which shall be administered by the Department of Health ("Department") in accordance with paragraph (3) of this subsection.
Revenue received pursuant to subsection (a) of this section shall be deposited in the Fund.
Money in the Fund shall be used to support the operations of the Department.
Notwithstanding subsection (a) of this section, the fee for a certificate of birth shall be waived for an individual experiencing homelessness.
For the purposes of this subsection, the term "individual experiencing homelessness" means a person:
Who is lacking a fixed, regular residence that provides safe housing and the financial means to acquire such a residence immediately; or
A supervised publicly or privately operated shelter or transitional housing facility designed to provide temporary living accommodations; or
A public or private place not designed for, or ordinarily used as, a regular sleeping accommodation for human beings.
The Mayor, pursuant to subchapter I of Chapter 5 of Title 2, shall issue rules to implement the provisions of this subsection.

annotations.annotation: Delegation of Authority Pursuant to the Vital Records Act of 1981, see Mayor’s Order 2002-13, February 1, 2002 ( 49 DCR 930).

Applicability of D.C. Law 21-195: § 5 of D.C. Law 21-195 provided that the change made to this section by § 2 of D.C. Law 21-195 is subject to the inclusion of the law’s fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan. Therefore that amendment has not been implemented.
